meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable or appropriate
meanings.sent1: Her fitness for the job was evident from her experience and skills.
meanings.sent2: The fitness of the dress for the occasion was questioned by the fashion critics.
meanings.sent3: His fitness for the role of a superhero was comically evident as he struggled to lift a small prop.
meanings.sent4: The fitness of the puzzle pieces to fit together perfectly was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The fitness of the plan to succeed relied heavily on teamwork and coordination.

meanings.definition: The condition of being physically fit and healthy
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise and a balanced diet are essential for maintaining good fitness.
meanings.sent2: Her dedication to her fitness routine paid off with increased strength and energy.
meanings.sent3: His fitness level was so high that he could outrun even the fastest athletes in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The fitness of her body was like a well-tuned engine, ready for any physical challenge.
meanings.sent5: The fitness of the marathon runner was evident in the way he effortlessly completed the race.

meanings.definition: The ability to cope with a particular situation or task
meanings.sent1: Her mental fitness allowed her to stay calm and focused during the stressful presentation.
meanings.sent2: The team's collective fitness to handle the crisis was put to the test during the emergency.
meanings.sent3: His fitness to juggle multiple tasks at once was both impressive and slightly chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The fitness of the new employee to adapt to the fast-paced environment was commendable.
meanings.sent5: The fitness of the computer system to handle large amounts of data was crucial for the success of the project.
